We have been in Barcelona for nearly two months now and have eaten in many restaurants.  Montiel is the best overall experience we have had:  food, ambience, and service were all first class.Montiel is tucked away in a quiet street on the square behind the Museu Picasso.  Very small, intimate and tastefully decorated.  We chose the 7 course tasting menu with the wine pairings.  I'm usually not a big fan of wine pairings but, in this case, it was fabulous.  The sommelier was knowledgeable and very informative and the wines, mainly Catalan, were very interesting.  All of the 7 courses were wonderful.  I particularly liked the favorful red mullet and the wine paired with it (that I can't recall).  There was also an interesting beet dish as well as tuna tartare.Montiel is not cheap but, for a special dinner, it is the place to go.
